world.arrive: You arrive in the overworld. Towns: small (t), big (T), cities (C). Dungeons (D). Press G on a town/dungeon tile to enter/exit.

dungeon.noDeeper: This dungeon has no deeper levels. Return to the entrance (the hole '>') and press G to leave.
dungeon.needStairs: You need to stand on the staircase (brown tile marked with '>').
dungeon.noDescendHere: There is nowhere to go down from here.
dungeon.floorEnemyCount0: You sense no enemies on this floor.
dungeon.floorEnemyCount1: You sense 1 enemy on this floor.
dungeon.floorEnemyCountMany: You sense {n} enemies on this floor.

town.exitHint: Return to the town gate to exit to the overworld.

encounter.exitHint: Return to the exit (>) to leave this encounter.

entrance.familyRumor: You hear rumors about recent troubles with {family}.
entrance.generalRumor: You catch a stray rumor as you arrive.

variety.tryTown: You get the sense the townsfolk have different work for you.
variety.tryDungeon: You hear whispers that the dungeons have changed since your last delve.
variety.tryWorld: Rumors speak of new routes and encounters out on the overworld.

mechanic.fishingHint: You overhear talk about strange fish being caught nearby.
mechanic.lockpickingHint: Someone brags that locked chests hold more than the obvious rewards.
mechanic.questBoardHint: Adventurers whisper that unusual jobs sometimes appear on this board.
mechanic.followersHint: You catch a comment that no one survives long in these lands alone.

npcRumors.trollSlayer: A local mutters: "They say someone has a grudge against trolls around here..."
npcRumors.townProtector: You overhear: "The town sleeps easier thanks to a certain defender."
npcRumors.caravanAlly: Merchants whisper: "Caravans seem to like that one."
npcRumors.familySlayer: Someone mentions trouble for the {family} in recent days.
npcRumors.familyAlly: An idle rumor suggests the {family} have a friend in town.

guardFine.prompt:
A patrol of guards stops you on the road.
They demand a fine of {amount} gold for your crimes.

Pay the fine?
guardFine.noMoney: A patrol of guards stops you on the road, but you cannot afford their fine. They will remember this.
guardFine.paid: You pay {amount} gold to settle your fine with the guards.
guardFine.refused: You refuse to pay the fine. The guards will remember this.
